info.title: PagerDuty Jira Server Integration API
info.description: This is API documentation for PagerDuty's integration with a Jira Server and is compatible with the Atlassian marketplace add-on verison 4.0.0+. Additional integration documentation can be found here: https://support.pagerduty.com/docs/jira-server

tags.name: Rules
tags.description: Rules are used to configure bi-directional incident/issue synchronization.

total.name: total
total.description: Returns the total number of records matched by the query if enabled.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Set the maximum number of results matched by the query.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

ArgumentError.description: Caller provided invalid arguments. Please review the response for error details. Retrying with the same arguments will *not* work.

Forbidden.description:
Caller is not authorized to view the requested resource.
While your authentication is valid, the authenticated user or token does not have permission to perform this action.

NotFound.description: The requested resource was not found.

enabled.description: Indicates if the rule is enabled

config.description: Contatins an object which describes a rule

sync_comments.description: Indicates if comments should be synchronized

services.description: An array of the PagerDuty services

issue_types.description: An array of Jira issue types

autocreate_issues.description: Indicates if automatic Jira issue creation is enabled

autocreate_issues_config.description: An array of rules that are applied when automatic Jira issue creation is enabled

autocreate_incidents.description: Indicates if automatic PagerDuty incident creation is enabled

autocreate_incidents_config.description: An array of rules that are applied when automatic PagerDuty incident creation is enabled

react_on_incident_event.description: Indicates if reaction on PagerDuty incident updates is enabled

react_on_incident_event_config.description: An array of rules that are applied to the Jira issue when reaction on PagerDuty incident updates is enabled

react_on_issue_status_change.description: Indicates if reaction on Jira issue status change is enabled

react_on_issue_status_change_config.description: An array of rules that are applied to the PagerDuty incident when reaction on Jira issue status change is enabled

RuleAutocreateIncidentConfigurationItem.description: Configuration item of the rule for automatical PagerDuty incidents creation from the Jira issues

jql.description: Rule will be applied, when issue matches the JQL

on_create.description: Apply the rule on issue creation

on_update.description: Apply the rule on issue update

target_service.description: Service, where an incident should be created

RuleAutocreateIssueConfigurationItem.description: Configuration item of the rule for automatical/manual Jira issues creation from PagerDuty incidents

target_project.description: Project, where the issue should be created

target_issue_type.description: Issue Type, which should set on the issue

RuleReactOnIncidentEventConfigurationIte.description: Configuration item of the rule for updating an issue that will only be applied when the incident is already linked and conditions are met

target_project.description: Project, where the issue should be created

target_issue_type.description: Issue Type, which should set on the issue

RuleReactOnIssueStatusChangeConfiguratio.description: Configuration item of the rule for updating an incident that will only be applied when there is a change in status

RuleConditionPdCreateIssueEvents.description: A list of PagerDuty incident actions which should be matched to create a Jira issue

RuleConditionPdUpdateIssueEvents.description: A list of PagerDuty incident actions which should be matched to update a Jira issue

RuleConditionPdPriorities.description: A list of PagerDuty priorities that should be matched to create/update a Jira issue

RuleConfitionPdUrgency.description: A PagerDuty urgency that should be matched to create/update a Jira issue

RuleActions.description: Actions that applied when the rule will be executed

RuleActionsParams.description: Configuration of actions that applied when the rule will be executed

PriorityReference.description: The reference to the PagerDuty priority

summary.description: A short-form, server-generated string that provides succinct, important information about an object suitable for primary labeling of an entity in a client. In many cases, this will be identical to `name`, though it is not intended to be an identifier.

type.description: A string that determines the schema of the object. This must be the standard name for the entity, suffixed by `_reference` if the object is a reference.

self.description: The API show URL at which the object is accessible

html_url.description: A URL at which the entity is uniquely displayed in the Web app

more.description: Indicates if there are additional records to return.

total.description: The total number of records matching the given query.

post.description:
Creates a rule.

> ### Action required!
>
>  Make sure that all required PagerDuty and Jira webhooks are present. You can do this by clicking **Check webhooks** button on the *Rules* page of the PagerDuty Jira application

get.description: Get details about an existing rule.

put.description:
Update an existing rule.

> ### Action required!
>
>  Make sure that all required PagerDuty and Jira webhooks are present. You can do this by clicking **Check webhooks** button on the *Rules* page of the PagerDuty Jira application

delete.description:
Delete an existing rule.

> ### Action required!
>
>  Make sure that all required PagerDuty and Jira webhooks are present. You can do this by clicking **Check webhooks** button on the *Rules* page of the PagerDuty Jira application
